metadata.case_name: Appellant (Returned Candidate) v. Rishi Kumar Kaushal

facts.text: In the General Election held in 1967, the appellant and the respondent filed nominations for election to the Jammu Kashmir Legislative Assembly from the Reasi Assembly Constituency.
Scrutiny of nomination papers conducted on January 23, 1967.
Counting of ballot papers on February 27, 1967; appellant declared duly elected by a majority of 418 votes.
Respondent filed Election Petition No. 37 of 1967 on April 8, 1967 challenging appellant's election on grounds of corrupt practices committed by appellant, his agents and others with his consent.

J&K High Court by judgment dated December 15, 1969 declared appellant's election void on ground that paras 16, 17 and 20 of booklet Ex. P.W.1/II constitute corrupt practices u/s 132(4) of J&K RP Act, 1957.

Booklet Ex. P.W.1/II titled 'Open letter from Dehati (Rural) Conference to Mr. Rishi Kumar Kaushal and other Jan Sangh leaders' published by Lal Singh (R.W.53), active Congress worker and appellant's polling agent, in first week of December 1966 as rejoinder to Jan Sangh poster Ex. P.W.1/B.
Booklet Ex. P.W.1/II distributed and circulated by Lal Singh, other Congress workers including appellant's election agent, and appellant himself in villages during election and before poll.

Para 16 of Ex. P.W.1/II refers to incident in September 1966 where Dhani Ram and Baldev Singh (R.W.37) went to Reasi, caught shopkeeper sawing wood unauthorisedly, attacked by town people including respondent, kept in jail overnight, filed complaint in court of D.C. Udhampur against 10-11 persons including respondent, compromised after respondent gave small coins paise and asked pardon.

Baldev Singh (R.W.37) deposed to incident on Sep 14, 1966, attack by town people including respondent, filing complaint Ex. R.W.37/1 dated Sep 19, 1966 before A.D.M. Udhampur naming respondent as 9th accused.

Durga Dutt (R.W.18), lawyer at Udhampur and maternal uncle of appellant, filed complaints on Sep 20, 1966 based on vakalats Ex. R.W.18/2 and R.W.18/2A; complaints forwarded to SHO Reasi for investigation.
Criminal complaints compromised; R.W.43 deposed respondent got case compromised assuring to pay any fine.

Para 17 of Ex. P.W.1/II refers to incident 4 years prior where Hindus and Muslims of Talwada seized cattle/livestock of hill peasants taking to home, impounded, peasants filed cases, some Talwada persons arrested; respondent did no help, only propaganda on cow-slaughter.
Para 20 of Ex. P.W.1/II states Dehati Conference set up Nov 20, 1966; sarcastically tells town people including respondent to put iron curtain and enjoy wealth robbed from poor villagers.

Other paras 7,8,10,18,19 of Ex. P.W.1/II: Para 7 - respondent threw stones at ministers/govt officers visiting Reasi; Para 8 - respondent put villagers forefront in agitations, went underground; Para 10 - during wheat shortage, stopped supply to villages, distributed rotten atta; Para 18 - no minister/officer left Reasi without stoning in 20 years; Para 19 - instigated attack on Khan Saheb (Mohd Ayub Khan, R.W.50) last year.
Violent demonstrations against ministers: Sep 1965 against Mohd Ayub Khan (R.W.50) by Jan Sangh, stones pelted, manhandling; respondent leading or instigated via father/election agent.
Respondent sitting MLA, Jan Sangh/Praja Parishad leader; arrested in 1952 agitation with lathi charge/firing.

legal_issues.text: Whether statements in paras 16,17,20 of Ex. P.W.1/II constitute corrupt practice u/s 132(4) J&K RP Act 1957 [equiv to s.123(4) RP Act 1951] i.e. false statements of fact re personal character/conduct of respondent reasonably calculated to prejudice his election prospects.
Whether finding on publication/distribution of booklet by appellant/agents is vitiated for not specifying accepted/rejected evidence.
Whether statements in paras 7,8,10,18,19 constitute corrupt practice u/s 132(4).

petitioner_arguments.text: Statements in paras 16,17,20 do not relate to personal character/conduct of respondent but criticism of him as politician and Jan Sangh party's activities/ideology.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.132(4) J&K RP Act; T.K. Gangi Reddy; Inder Lal v. Lal Singh; Kultar Singh; Sheopat Singh; Dev Kanta Barooah; Guruji Shrihar

petitioner_arguments.text: Statements in para 16 true: criminal complaint filed against respondent, compromised after he paid money/apology.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.132(4) requires false statement believed false/not believed true

petitioner_arguments.text: High Court finding on distribution merely extracts evidence without accepting/rejecting specific evidence, vitiated.
Paras 7,18,19 directed against Jan Sangh party attitude, not personal to respondent.

respondent_arguments.text: Paras 16,17,20 contain false statements re personal character/conduct: para16 - apologized/paid to escape criminal case, associate of drunkards; para17 - preacher of cow-slaughter, fraud, begging votes humiliatingly; para20 - looted/appropriated poor's wealth.
Overwhelming evidence of distribution by appellant's agent Lal Singh, workers, appellant.
Paras 7,8,10,18,19 false: esp paras7,18,19 attribute violence/stone-throwing/instigation to respondent; para10 rotten atta supply; para8 deception in agitations.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: T.K. Gangi Reddy (acts of violence relate to personal character)

court_reasoning.text: s.132(4) requires false statement re personal (not public/political) character/conduct, believed false/not believed true, reasonably calculated to prejudice prospects. Distinction from public/political criticism; counter-blast irrelevant.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Personal = moral/mental nature, depravity, immorality, violence; political open to criticism.

court_reasoning.text: Paras 17,20 not re personal character: political criticism of ignoring villagers, seeking votes undeservedly, town-village disparity; no preach cow-slaughter/fraud/begging/looting.
Para 16: no associate of drunkards (only sathis/supporters drink, retaliation to town accusing villagers); incident/ compromise true per evidence (RWs 37,12,18,43, Exs).
Paras 8,10 not personal: political conduct in agitations/wheat shortage as MLA.
Paras 7,18,19 attribute violence (stone-throwing/instigation) - serious re personal character, but true per evidence (demonstrations 1965, 1952; RWs 50,28,31; respondent leader).

holdings.text: No corrupt practice u/s 132(4) in paras 16,17,20: not personal or true.
No corrupt practice in paras 7,8,10,18,19: not personal or true.
High Court erred in setting aside election.

precedents_cited.case_name: T. K. Gangi Reddy v. M. C. Anjaneya Reddy
precedents_cited.relevance: Personal character/conduct clear; counter-blast irrelevant; violence re personal.
Read document as whole objectively; election atmosphere partisan.
s.123(4) balances speech/freedom; true/bona fide statements protected; calculated = designed to prejudice.

precedents_cited.case_name: Dev Kanta Barooah v. Golok Chandra Baruah
precedents_cited.relevance: 'Deshdrohita' re political conduct siding British, not personal.

precedents_cited.case_name: Guruji Shrihar Baliram Jivatode v. Vithalrao
precedents_cited.relevance: No reflection on moral/mental qualities = not personal.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ramanbhai Ashabhai Patel v. Dabhi Ajitkumar Fulsinji
precedents_cited.relevance: Respondent can support decree on grounds negatived below.

precedents_cited.case_name: Shri Thepfulo Nakhro Angami v. Shrimati Raveluei alias Rani M. Shaiza

precedents_cited.relevance: False fact re personal vs political position.

statutes_cited.name: Jammu and Kashmir Representation of the People Act, 1957
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines corrupt practices; s.132(4) equiv s.123(4) RP Act 1951 on false statements re personal character/conduct.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: s.123(4) corresponds to J&K Act s.132(4); s.116A to J&K s.123 for appeals.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; High Court judgment set aside; appellant's election from Reasi Constituency upheld as no corrupt practices proved under s.132(4).

key_quotes.text: "The words Personal character and conduct are so clear that they do not require further elucidation or definition."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines scope of s.123(4) from T.K. Gangi Reddy.

key_quotes.text: "If a false statement is made with regard to the public or political character of the candidate, it would not constitute a corrupt practice even if it is likely to prejudice the prospects of that candidate's election."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core principle distinguishing personal vs political.

key_quotes.text: "There are no statements of fact in paragraphs 17 and 20 of Ex. P.W.1/II in relation to the personal character or conduct of the respondent."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects High Court on specific paras.
